thread.title: Prosecutors call for eight-year jail term for Connor, British boyfriend - Yahoo7
thread.title_full: Prosecutors call for eight-year jail term for Connor, British boyfriend - Yahoo7

author: Aap On February
title: Prosecutors call for eight-year jail term for Connor, British boyfriend - Yahoo7
text:
Share Prosecutors call for eight-year jail term for Connor, British boyfriend - Yahoo7 Prosecutors have called for Australian woman Sara Connor and her British boyfriend to be jailed for eight years after they allegedly bashed a Bali police officer and left him for dead. Close Connor defends decision to destoy evidence UP NEXT VIDEO Connor defends decision to destoy evidence 
Connor, a mother of two, said nothing as she was rushed from the Denpasar Court to the holding cells on Tuesday. 
Her lawyer Erwin Siregar described such a request as "extraordinary" and said they needed time to prepare their defence. Sara Connor in court. Picture: AAP 
Connor and David Taylor had gone to trial facing charges of murder, fatal assault in company and assault causing death over death of Bali police officer Wayan Sudarsa, whose bloodied body was discovered on Kuta Beach in the early hours of August 17 last year. 
But on Tuesday prosecutor Agung Jayalantara said the couple should not be convicted of murder - which carries with it a maximum penalty of 15 years. 
It was clear, he added, that the pair had not intended to kill Mr Sudarsa. British man Dave Taylor. Picture: AAP 
Instead, the prosecutor submitted they should be convicted of fatal assault in company, which carries a maximum of 12 years. 
It's alleged the couple had been holidaying in Bali when they realised Connor's purse had gone missing, so Taylor confronted Mr Sudarsa but did not get the response from the police officer he was hoping for. 
Referring to a psychological evaluation of Taylor made after his arrest on August 19, the prosecutor said: "Since there's no help, (he) felt like he was being treated as suspect and the influence of liquor, it made the subject emotional and overwhelmed. Connor was quickly escorted from the court to the holding cells. Picture: AAP 
"(Taylor) felt very insulted and angry then they got involved in a fight." 
After the fight, in which Taylor hit Mr Sudarsa with a beer bottle, the prosecutor said the 34-year-old had reported that the police officer was still breathing. 
The pair then left him on the beach. 
Mr Jayalantara said this showed they did not mean to intentionally kill him. Australian mother Sara Connor. Picture: AAP 
However, he argued there was clearly some "guilt" attached to what they did on Kuta beach - with the pair taking and destroying Mr Sudarsa's identity cards and then later burning their clothes. 
The court heard Taylor felt regret at what had happened to Mr Sudarsa and for "involving" Connor. 
"(He feels he has) failed to help and protect the person he loves," the psychological report states. 
The matter is expected to return to court next week where both parties will present their defence.
